channel.title: Tech
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from Tech, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Fintech CEO and Forbes 30 Under 30 alum has been charged for alleged fraud
item.description: The startup CEO says she plans to publicly address the charges this week.

item.title: Avalanche thinks the fusion power industry should think smaller
item.description: Avalanche has raised $29 million in fresh funding to pursue its unique approach to fusion power, which can currently fit on a table.

item.title: Elon Musk’s SpaceX officially acquires Elon Musk’s xAI, with plan to build data centers in space
item.description: The merger creates the world's most valuable private company and paves the way for Musk to try and prove out the usefulness of space-based data center...

item.title: Elon Musk’s SpaceX officially acquires Elon Musk’s xAI, with plan to build data centers in space
item.description: The merger creates the world's most valuable private company, and paves the way for Musk to try and prove out the usefulness of space-based data cente...

item.title: Waymo raises $16B to scale robotaxi fleet internationally
item.description: Waymo said the funds will be used to fuel its growth, which has accelerated over the past year and doesn't appear to be slowing.

item.title: China is leading the fight against hidden car door handles
item.description: The Chinese government issued a new rule that goes into effect January 1, 2027.

item.title: HHS Is Using AI Tools From Palantir to Target ‘DEI’ and ‘Gender Ideology’ in Grants
item.description: Since March of 2025, the Department of Health and Human Services has been using tools from Palantir and the startup Credal AI to weed out perceived al...

item.title: Two Stanford students launch $2M startup accelerator for students nationwide
item.description: "Breakthrough’s purpose is to fill in the funding and opportunity gap that exists in many of these ecosystems because students have historically lacke...

item.title: Adobe Animate is shutting down as company focuses on AI
item.description: Adobe Animate will be discontinued on March 1, 2026, as Adobe shifts its focus to AI.

item.title: China is leading the fight against hidden car door handles
item.description: Under new safety rules published Monday by China's Ministry of Industry and Information Technology, cars sold in the country must have mechanical rele...
